lexUnit.name: deduce.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: arrive at (a fact or a conclusion) by reasoning.

sentence.text: We have no choice but to deduce as much as we can about the baking of the cake from studying what happens if we miss out a constituent , alter the temperature or cooking time or whatever â€¦
Penman had even filled a port decanter , Alexandra noticed , deducing quite rightly , that as she would hardly drink any , Christmas munificence would prompt her to tell him to help himself .
Existence of a natural isotope effect not dependent on mass complicates efforts to deduce the history of the Solar System by studying isotope ratios .
As viewers of this scene we could also have deduced something about the relationship between John and Mary from the way they were sitting together and the way they looked at each other .
One palm reader may deduce her findings from a comparison between lines and hand form , while another may simply use the palm rather as she uses , at other times , a crystal ball .
The deductive method in science is , as the name implies , the attempt to deduce all scientific facts from higher laws , which act as unassailable axioms .
Some figures of deaths in monastic houses may be accurate , but as the plague did not strike evenly throughout the country it would be foolish to deduce any estimate of national mortality from them .
Although there was no specific statutory requirement that justices should be named , the court deduced such a requirement from the fundamental nature of the open justice principle .
If one tries to deduce human behavior from the laws of science , one gets caught in the logical paradox of self-referencing systems .
The Oxford group was at the forefront of X-ray crystallography , a technique for deducing atomic architecture from the way X-rays are scattered .
So it is possible to deduce swimming habits in fossil bivalves by comparison with the living forms .
Something had upset her , Roland reasonably deduced .
` Sounds as if she killed herself then " Maxim deduced .
What characteristics of hierarchical structures can you deduce from studying the chart ?

It was relatively easy for Flora , sitting at the bottom of the Leighs ' dining-table , to keep quiet , eat what was offered , and deduce by watching her neighbours the correct order of knives and forks .
What new developments in science would he be able to deduce from the features of my automobile and its contents ?
The reaction of the urban proletariat was natural ; one can not safely deduce from it any decisive change in attitude towards death and survival .
It is unacceptable to deduce from the lack of prosecutions that hooligan behaviour was formerly tolerated to such a degree that the culprits were neither censured nor prosecuted .
However , no one except a Christian anarchist or a Tolstoyan has ever deduced from this that socialism is against revolutionary violence .
Glancing around , she deduced from the sounds drifting from the kitchen that Tara was preparing a meal .
Her thighs and knees could quite conceivably , she deduced in bewilderment , be turning to rubber .
From a knowledge of what edges and surfaces are present , and how they are oriented relative to the eye , we are able to deduce with some confidence what three-dimensional objects are present .
Eventually , she deduced the kid must have gone to find Nathan , who 'd slept in that morning and missed breakfast .
The falsity of universal statements can be deduced from suitable singular statements .

The exact role of cortisol is unknown , but its importance can be deduced from the observation that animals that can not produce cortisol , due to injury for instance , are very vulnerable in emergencies .
I 'd like to emphasize that this idea that time and space should be finite without boundary is just a proposal : it can not be deduced from some other principle .
( What would have happened at Verdun had Renault remained out of business can readily be deduced from what has already been said about the Voie SacrÃ©e . )
The importance that the General attributed to these events may be deduced from the enormous pains he took to prepare for them .
By analogy , we can hope to deduce what must be in an animal 's head by observing what it does .
So we can deduce what the field of vision of our globular-eyed trilobite was , by looking at the directions in which all the lenses face .
From households ' expenditure patterns it is possible to deduce how much indirect and intermediate tax is paid , and there is a straightforward entry of the direct taxes each family pays .
A more realistic alternative is to deduce which characteristics of organizations have the most impact on accounting .
From the observation of fossils far inland , and in many of the places to which he travelled , he deduced that the whole Earth had once been covered by water .
Whatever happens , either we obtain an efficient solution or we can deduce that there are no efficient solutions .
One can only deduce that the Eurasian and African plates began driving together at this time , with the latter dragged down beneath the rising Alpine mountains .
` I deduce the corpse we have just seen does not belong to James IV .
From this fact , the Pythagoreans deduced a kind of table of ten pairs of essential opposites , which they claimed are important for understanding the universe .
Did you deduce this from the symptoms you saw or was there harder evidence ? "
